oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Piece of apple tree where General Robert E. Lee surrendered at Appomattox Court House
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Small piece of wood reportedly from a tree near where General Robert E. Lee surrendered at Appomattox Court House. The document in which the wood was wrapped reads "Piece of the Famous Apple Tree Where Lee Surrendered at Appomattox Court House; Virginia." According to the donor, item could possibly have been collected by Norman Stewart, a private in Company A, of the 189th Regiment, New York Infantry.
